item.title: Multi Faith Centre Development
item.description: The University of Exeter has green-lit the building of a new Multi-Faith Centre behind the Forum building. Replacing the existing Muslim prayer rooms and multi-faith spaces in the Old Library. The new building will be located in the green area behind the Forum Kitchen, and down the steps from the Starbucks outside seating area. The University has said that it will pursue building the Centre according to sustainable practices whilst aiming to reduce carbon emissions during the process.

item.title: Utilizing Brexit for Rewilding
item.description: Before Brexit, agriculture in the UK was subscribed to the Common Agricultural Policy (CAP) which focused on ensuring “affordable, safe and high-quality food”, supporting farmers’ incomes, and protecting the environment. This policy was used as a catch-all system, ignoring the fact that certain areas might benefit from something more bespoke. Since about 2017, DEFRA, the government department responsible for all things relating to the environment, food production, and rural affairs, has been telling farmers to prepare for a change.
